704734f-a.title: Brooklyn: Halsey Street - Broadway
704734f-a.text:
Halsey Sbreet, north side, west from Broadway, showing the Halsey Street
Trolley Line.
1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703344f-a.title: Brooklyn: Broadway - Halsey Street
703344f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, south from Halsey Street. (In 1871 Paul W.
Ledoux, a Canadian who resided in New York City, bought a lot of land
bounded by Broadway, Bushwick Ave., and Eldert and Halsey Streets, on which
13 stores and several dwellings were erected. In 1891, he refused
2 100.000 for a 200 feet frontage on Broadway. In 1905 he sold 180' Y1O0'
on Broadway for~ 225.000. He, among others, was instrumental in having
the Halsey Street trolley line extended). Overhead is a portion of the
Broadway line of the Brooklyn Elevated system.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703343f-a.title: Brooklyn: Broadway - Halsey Street
703343f-a.text:
Broadway, south of Halsey Street, showing the Broadway Elevated line of
the B.M.f.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collectien.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

704733f-a.title: Brooklyn: Halsey Street - Broadway
704733f-a.text:
Halsey Street, north side, west from Broadway.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
